answeredQuestions.what-building: CLI tool to help build solutions using AI and Github Copilot CLI
answeredQuestions.core-problem: Need for autonomous, collaborative AI agent teams that can work together to achieve defined objectives without constant manual intervention
answeredQuestions.solution-approach: Prescriptive team-based workflow with multi-agent personas, parallel execution, shared workspace (.teambot), history file management, and visualization
answeredQuestions.testing-approach: Code-first with TDD where appropriate for better product quality
answeredQuestions.technical-constraints: No tmux for windowing - use independent windows with reliable messaging/synchronization mechanism. No specific Python version requirements or performance targets.
answeredQuestions.agent-personas: PM/Planner/Coordinator, Reviewer (all artifacts), Builder/Implementer x2 (parallel work), Business Analyst, Technical Writer/Documentor
answeredQuestions.frontmatter-schema: title, description, timestamp, agent-id, action-type (verbose but concise descriptor of what was done)
answeredQuestions.prescriptive-workflows: Setup → Business Problem (for big changes) → Spec → review → research → test strategy → plan → review → task implementation → review → test → post implementation review
answeredQuestions.visualization-approach: Console output with good use of colors, positioning, simple but informative - NO tmux
answeredQuestions.window-management: TeamBot automatically creates windows/panes based on default/initial configuration (user-configurable)
answeredQuestions.inter-agent-messaging: Python multiprocessing queues for real-time coordination + file-based persistence in .teambot for durable state
answeredQuestions.window-creation: Python subprocess with OS-native new console (subprocess.CREATE_NEW_CONSOLE on Windows, start_new_session on Linux/Unix, osascript for macOS Terminal)
answeredQuestions.objective-structure: Markdown with: project description, definition of done, success criteria, implementation specifics
answeredQuestions.success-metrics: Autonomous completion without human intervention based on definition of done and success criteria
answeredQuestions.mvp-timeline: No timeline - prioritize quality and reliability over speed
answeredQuestions.history-file-limits: No hard limits; smart warning system when approaching context boundaries with compaction options (little/medium/high summarization)

nextActions: Define message protocol for multiprocessing queues
